data.description: When using a concentric top/bottom pattern (a pattern consisting of closed contours, otherwise known as polygons), connect all contours together such that they form one single path.
data.img_description: The first image shows a naive concentric pattern. The second shows that all contours get connected together to form one curve.
data.hints: This prevents travel moves for the most part. However it creates new sharp corners where the nozzle will have to accelerate and decelerate a lot, which will offset against the win in printing time. The squiggly pattern will also be visible on the outside, which gives an interesting visual effect.
data.notes: - The contours created by Extra Skin Wall Count are not connected.
